author: Andrii Voloshyn
title: Crypto-Targeted Promotion Campaign
description: There is a need to encourage entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst

assessments.note: I believe this is a good idea, the proposal seeks to increase the media content related to the catalyst platform throughout the crypto ecosystem and it is considered that the amount of content in the ecosystem can be an important factor in increasing the success criteria of this challenge.  But there are many other factors not addressed in the proposal that enter at stake for meaningful participation from proponents, advisers and voters.

While I can see that some value might be had by onboarding the uninitiated I feel this proposal would have been better suited to proposer outreach. Having said that I recognise that new clients/consumers may be sourced with this initiative.

Assuming that the data in the stated problem is really an issue, i.e., that the intersection between the entrepreneurs which are doing business outside Cardano's world and inside is quite small, I still fail to grasp why it actually happens – which I imagine that if this entrepreneur works inside crypto world, I assume that he might have looked into Cardano, since it's in the top 10 in market cap coins nowadays. Therefore, I think the idea would have a great gain if the problem that should be tackled were more well defined.

I understand what you are proposing and I agree that more marketing couldn't hurt!  But I do think your problem / solution statement could do with some refinement.  To play devil's advocate:

Problem Statement:
- Does it really address the campaign brief, given that the campaign brief seems to be emphasize more participation from existing community members, rather than funneling in new ones?

 Campaign scope aside, do you think this is actually a problem right now?  I thought Catalyst is currently the largest decentralized innovation fund in the world-- so relatively speaking, it may not necessarily be the most urgent problem, but please clarify why you think this is a problem.
 
Solution Statement:

 - Will the platforms you suggest contain the sort of audience that will be valuable with respect to submitting proposals to Catalyst?  Will the participation be meaningful?  If so, why?

 - How will this increase 'efficiency', as you suggest?

 - It seems like cryptotexty is very Ukraine-centric, despite English translations being available.  I am not saying this is a bad thing, and I think it only helps to increase promotional efforts in all regions; but given Cardano's initial emphasis on Africa, and the limited funds available, why do you think it is valuable to concentrate promotional efforts in Ukraine (if my premise is correct)?

The problem description doesn't describe a problem, I recommend modifying it to clarify the purpose of the proposal.

The concept/plan is within the scope of the challenge, as it deals with the creation of articles related to Catalyst and the dissemination of material on different platforms. This has great potential to increase onboarding.

My recommendation is the setting of goals, so that we can measure the impact objectively.
Possible a good proposal for Cardano, however it does not address the challenge which is focused inwards on the community, not outwards.

I believe that the idea is good, the more content about Catalyst out there, the better. Although, the cost per article is a bit misleading in my opinion, it should not account for number of platforms, by only for different articles. Let's say the same article was published in 240 platforms. It would have the same cost per article per platform, but the amount of information out there would be the same. Most people might find this information from googling instead of looking at specific platforms. In this way, the cost per article is $375, which is quite high. The proposer mentions it could very well do 30 articles, which would bring the cost down to $200 per article, which is better. I believe this should be incorporated as a target goal, not only optional.

The proposal addresses part of the Fund 5 Metadata challenge. The problem is well described, including the solution. The only question is, how will this proposal attract entrepreneurs? It is good to post to get engagement and expand the Cardano brand awareness, but how will you make sure that your message appeals to entrepreneurs.

Although the proposal informs on the team's marketing experience and refers to a YouTube channel where domain interviews are conducted, there is not enough information on the proponent and the team members to allow a proper evaluation,  because no former content articles are available. To promote the Catalyst Platform brand, it is important to emphasize the generation of quality content and for this reason is recommended to include evidence of publication of past articles associated with the blockchain ecosystem in the proposal. Also, due to how the information is presented, it seems that the proponent allocates the same amount of budget for the creation of content and the replication of the same content on the different platforms.
I feel that the team certainly have the skillset to deliver on this proposal. My concern is the target audience is not entirely valid for the challenge.

It would be good see an actual evidence of the cited experience.
One thing that I am struggling to understand is that the price per article is stated as $25 per article per platform, resulting in 240 publications in total (16 articles in total). However the plain is to scale the idea and it's not clear how this growth would be financed, meaning that a better explanation in how it would monetize itself to allow the production of more articles would be of great relevance.

Are there any examples of articles that you would generate?  I understand that you interview crypto subject matter experts on your YouTube channel, but how does this translate in to articles?  I see on your website, https://cryptotexty.com/, that you post articles of those interviews, but they seem to be moreso direct transcriptions of the interviews, rather than a synthesis of the key learnings from the interview.

Are there any examples of of the articles that you would generate?  I think addressing this concern is critical to give voters a chance to understand the value you would bring with this effort.

Will all 16 articles be based on interviews you do, or sometimes just on other synthesized research that you've done on your own?

What if you don't line up an interviewee every week?  How will you generate an article for that week (if you wish to stick to your timetable of 1 article / week)?

The experience described by the team is related to what is necessary to execute the plan, but I recommend the inclusion of more information about the proposers and links to Linkedin or another reference source for your qualifications / work.

The budget described is reasonable and there are details on the budget allocation.

There is no clear definition of the content to be created, the suggested options are within the scope of the challenge, but I think it is important to describe in a more structured way what information about Catalyst will be prioritized.

When would the articles begin to be published? There is a definition of 1 article per week, for a period of 4 months, but the beginning of the timeline has not been described.
The proposer claims a reasonable amount of partially relevant experience, though no writing or production experience. It would be good to have some evidence of experience claimed (LinkedIn?)

The proposer seems to have some experiencein the area, although it is not easy to assess due to the lack of references. There is a youtube channel linked but with only a few videos, but no text directly referenced. It is not easy to assess the proposer capabilities in this way. It would be good to include more information to confirm the proposers capacity in delivering good quality articles.

It is likely for this targeted campaign to be implemented because it includes a straightforward campaign strategy. This proposal is feasible in the area of writing and posting articles across various mediums to promote Project Catalyst onboarding. The big question is in the visual content: How do you plan to deliver quality visual content to the segment of entrepreneurs. What is your visual content plan?

The proposal informs the content generation schedule, also informs that 16 articles will be generated and replicated on at least 15 platforms, it is not clear the number of hours that will be allocated, the proposal does not address whether it is necessary or not to assign a budget to pay a fee per publication on the aforementioned platforms. It is difficult to associate the content generation with the success criteria for this challenge, no key indicators are mentioned that allows to  evaluate the impact of the content generated.

Overall a valid proposal (albeit with some challenge misgivings). I remain neutral overall on the worth of this proposal as while I rate the commitment and energy of the team I'm torn on the outcome metrics being cost effective. Perhaps greater evidence of how each article will progress the message to the crypto community may have contributed to a improved submission.

A roadmap which explicit inform the dates and where the articles would be published would be a great information in this proposal. 
Besides that, a KPI to measure the success of the proposal would be of a great interest in order to validate the need of scale up the articles.

I think it's good that you have defined the number of articles, but after the submission of articles, are there any ways of measuring its impact?

Moreover, are there any metrics that you can provide for your current site with respect to traffic (ideally be region)?  Or even traffic that previous articles that you wrote that have generated high amounts of traffic / likes.  

I can tell that you're genuine in wanting to do this, since I saw in your channel that you were thinking about proposing this type of initiative way back in August.  I think this proposal would be stronger if you could proactively address many of the above questions / concerns, and it would definitely increase your chances of being funded.

There are details on the budget allocation. The plan describes the number of articles to be produced (at least 16) and the period of publication of the articles (1x week, for 4 months), which facilitates auditability.

There are no metrics or KPIs to assess proposal performance, which compromises the auditability.

I recommend the inclusion of this missing information, in addition to more details about the proposers, because despite being known in the Catalyst community, it is important that this be communicated in a transparent and clear way.
We can easily audit if the article are produced. What about metrics on quality, engagement etc? A plan to measure impact and meet the challenge goal would be useful.

Audit of this proposal would be easy, since the metrics are the amount of articles produced. Although, it would be good to have some metric about people who access Catalyst channels coming from the articles (links with tracked clicks for example). The goal in number of articles is there, but there is no information about the impact that would be expected, how many people would see that articles and other information like that.

This proposal needs a detailed roadmap and milestone. When do you plan to start posting the content? What day during the week will you be posting the articles? How many videos do you plan to publish? and by when?

solution: Wit Crypto-Targeted promotion focused on existing people with knowledge and interest in cryptocurrency industry we will have good efficiency
experience:
4+ years in marketing for crypto projects

15+ years in online marketing

Good knowledge of Cardano ecosystem and other blockchains
